{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162545,"name":"Rishi NIranjan","username":"Looper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/looper/{size}/183961_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-12T02:52:23.521Z","cooked":"

We can’t connect to our limelight via the robot WiFi. If we plug it in via Ethernet to a laptop, we can connect to it an access the web portal. If we set the IP address to a static one in the web portal then try to connect to it via WiFi, the limelight breaks and we have to reset the IP address by holding down the reset button. For the static IP, we set it to 10.TE.AM.11 and the Gateway mask to 255.255.255.0 (Gateway was set to 10.90.23.1). We tried the same thing with a second limelight 3 and these issues persist. Any help would be appreciated.

Have you tried another address besides 10.90.23.11? There might already be something on your network at that address. Disclaimer - haven’t used an LL3 yet.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-12T23:58:05.793Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":429903,"topic_slug":"limelight-3-breaks-everytime-we-set-its-ip-address-to-a-static-ip","display_username":"Rishi NIranjan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":29618,"username":"JohnD","name":"JohnD 3322","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56920,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-3-breaks-everytime-we-set-its-ip-address-to-a-static-ip/429903/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163057,"name":"Shawn","username":"chonkrdoggr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T00:24:49.903Z","cooked":"
  1. Download the Limelight Finder
  2. Connect to the robot’s wifi
  3. Click “find limelights” in the Limelight Finder
  4. Double-click on the static IP it gives you and you should be redirected to your Limelight pipeline.

If this doesn’t work, make sure you have the latest version of the Limelight flashed into your Limelight. If it’s not updated, follow these instructions under the Imaging portion of the page to update your Limelight. You will need a Micro-USB cable that looks like this to connect to the Limelight from your computer. Hope this helps!

It looks like you are working straight out of the manual. Is it correct that you can communicate with the LL3 at 10.90.23.11 over the cable and then when you switch to WiFi it doesn’t connect and after that you can no longer connect over the cable? That sounds like it might be a bad/misconfigured WiFI device so I suggest talking directly with tech support at LimeLight. They’ve been very helpful for our team in the past.

What is your roborio IP address set to? Limelight docs suggest setting it to 10.TE.AM.2.
